ParallelChunk.en: At one point, South Africa tried to convince Mugabe to transform his government into a government of national unity, opening it up to Mr Tsvangirai and his party.
ParallelChunk.fr: À un moment donné, l’Afrique du Sud a essayé de convaincre Mugabe d’ouvrir son gouvernement à un gouvernement d’Union nationale, de faire entrer Tsvangirai et son parti dans le gouvernement.

ParallelChunk.en: At one point, things had moved in the right direction.
ParallelChunk.fr: À un moment donné, les choses avaient bougé dans le bon sens.

ParallelChunk.en: Then , along came the sanctions, which again created an extremely difficult climate.
ParallelChunk.fr: Puis , sont arrivées les sanctions qui ont à nouveau créé un climat extrêmement difficile.

ParallelChunk.en: I vigorously condemn Mugabe’s attitude.
ParallelChunk.fr: Je condamne de la façon la plus énergique l’attitude de Mugabe.

ParallelChunk.en: I believe that the planned measures and sanctions should be applied against the Zimbabwean authorities.
ParallelChunk.fr: Je crois qu’il faut appliquer les mesures, les sanctions prévues à l’encontre des autorités zimbabwéennes.

ParallelChunk.en: There is no reason for not applying them. That goes without saying.
ParallelChunk.fr: Il n’y a pas de raison de ne pas les appliquer, cela va de soi.

ParallelChunk.en: I agree with most of what is contained in the resolution.
ParallelChunk.fr: Je partage l’essentiel de ce qu’il y a dans la résolution.

ParallelChunk.en: I am simply trying to explain to you the limits of what we can usefully do, because the problem is, in fact , one of doing things that are of use.
ParallelChunk.fr: J’essaie simplement de vous expliquer les limites de ce que nous pouvons faire utilement, parce que le problème c’est effectivement de faire les choses utilement.

ParallelChunk.en: Mr President, on a point of order, the Commissioner has had almost ten minutes to stand up and make an apologia for Mugabe’s regime and the inaction of Mbeki, the Commission and the Council.
ParallelChunk.fr: - Monsieur le Président, c’est une motion de procédure. Le commissaire a eu presque dix minutes pour faire l’apologie du régime Mugabe et de l’inaction de M. Mbeki, de la Commission et du Conseil.

ParallelChunk.en: This is disgraceful.
ParallelChunk.fr: C’est une honte.

ParallelChunk.en: There is a procedural problem in this House.
ParallelChunk.fr: Il existe un problème de procédure dans cette Assemblée.

ParallelChunk.en: How can we have a proper debate when we are limited to one or two minutes and then the microphone is turned off, while the Commissioner can stand up and make this disgraceful response?
ParallelChunk.fr: Comment pourrions-nous mener un débat correct si nous sommes limités à une ou deux minutes avant que le micro ne soit éteint, tandis que le commissaire peut intervenir et fournir cette réponse scandaleuse?

ParallelChunk.en: He has denied everything that every Member of this House, right across the political spectrum, has said.
ParallelChunk.fr: Il a ignoré toutes les déclarations de l’ensemble des députés de cette Assemblée, tous groupes politiques confondus.

ParallelChunk.en: We do not have the power, you have the power, Commissioner.
ParallelChunk.fr: Nous n’avons pas le pouvoir, Monsieur le Commissaire, mais vous l’avez.

ParallelChunk.en: I have been talking, along with other colleagues today, to members of the political opposition in many countries in Africa.
ParallelChunk.fr: Je me suis entretenu, à l’instar de plusieurs de mes collègues aujourd’hui, avec des membres de l’opposition politique de nombreux pays africains.

ParallelChunk.en: They do not share your view, Commissioner.
ParallelChunk.fr: Ils ne partagent pas votre point de vue, Monsieur le Commissaire.

ParallelChunk.en: It is the most disgraceful outburst I have heard from a Commissioner in a long time.
ParallelChunk.fr: C’est le débordement le plus scandaleux qu’il m’ait été donné d’entendre de la part d’un commissaire depuis longtemps.

ParallelChunk.en: The debate is closed.
ParallelChunk.fr: Le débat est clos.

ParallelChunk.en: The vote will take place today at 5.30 p.m.
ParallelChunk.fr: Le vote aura lieu aujourd’hui à 17h30.

Speaker.name: Ana Maria Gomes (PSE ).

ParallelChunk.en: – No, Mr President, I speak to the House not, unfortunately, as an author, but as a Member of the House and as head of the EU election observation mission to Ethiopia. The elections afforded the opposition and all of Ethiopian society an unprecedented voice, which is to Prime Minister Meles Zenawi’s credit.
ParallelChunk.fr: Il m’est agréable de pouvoir commencer mon intervention en vous annonçant la libération des six défenseurs des droits de l’homme - libération qu’exigeait la résolution que nous examinons aujourd’hui.

ParallelChunk.en: The presence of international observers, of which our mission was the most significant in terms of numbers and professional commitment, was a key factor in instilling confidence among the electorate, who turned out in their droves and 90% voted. The delegation sent by Parliament felt the sustained applause of voters queuing up on 15 May and for this reason the EU’s electoral mission feels an enormous responsibility.
ParallelChunk.fr: Ces personnes figuraient parmi des milliers d’autres qui étaient détenues dans la capitale éthiopienne, Addis Abeba, pendant et après les manifestations qui ont commencé le 6 juin et qui se sont poursuivies pendant plusieurs jours.

Speaker.ParallelChunk: It is crucial that the Ethiopian people have their expectations of true election results fulfilled and the mission will do all it can to ensure that this happens.

ParallelChunk.en: Nobody can know for sure what the election results will be because the process got into serious difficulty at the stage of counting the ballot papers.
ParallelChunk.fr: Trente-six personnes ont été tuées lors de ces troubles.

ParallelChunk.en: In addition to the delays in publishing the results, there were a large number of complaints from all parties, including the party in government.
ParallelChunk.fr: Bien que quelque 4 000 personnes aient maintenant été libérées, plusieurs milliers d’autres sont toujours en prison ou détenues dans des centres de détention non officiels de la police.

ParallelChunk.en: Concern among the population with regard to those delays and complaints was at the root of the tragic events of 6, 7 and 8 June, on which the mission immediately spoke out publicly. We called at the time for an independent inquiry and we continue to do so.
ParallelChunk.fr: Au regard de cette situation, l’Union européenne doit continuer à faire preuve de détermination et à exiger la poursuite de l’enquête relative à ces événements sans qu’aucune des parties n’y fasse opposition.

Speaker.ParallelChunk: Specifically, we call on the government to release those held in breach of constitutional guarantees and of human rights; we call for elected candidates and other opposition representatives, along with human rights campaigners, to be allowed the freedom to perform their duties; we call for media freedom and for opposition representatives to be allowed access to the media; we called then and call now on the opposition to hold back and discourage others from carrying out or calling for an insurgency, from calling for people to break constitutional law and from fomenting inter-ethnic conflict, which will ultimately only help those with a vested interest in ensuring that the results of the popular vote are never disclosed, those who, in turn, would stop at nothing to force the electoral process to be disrupted, leading to a spiral of violence and economic and political chaos; we call on both sides – government and opposition – to comply fully with the 10 June Agreement aimed at addressing complaints, which is backed by the main contributors, including the Member States.

ParallelChunk.en: At this point I wish to pay tribute to the representative of the Commission, who played – and continues to play – an outstanding role in Addis Ababa.
ParallelChunk.fr: D’autre part, il semble évident que l’opposition n’a ni l’intention ni les moyens d’organiser un soulèvement brutal qui compromettrait en fin de compte la victoire aux élections qu’elle prétend avoir remportée.

ParallelChunk.en: Our mission has been restructured to meet requests from both sides that we should observe this process of looking into complaints and I shall therefore be back in Addis Ababa next week.
ParallelChunk.fr: Le gouvernement ne peut cependant crier victoire, car, après plusieurs recomptages, il s’avère qu’il a perdu les élections.

Speaker.ParallelChunk: I shall finish, Mr President, by saying that the situation is very delicately and dangerously poised.
The risk of civil war is not mere rhetoric.

ParallelChunk.en: I have just heard the news that the main opposition announced this morning that it is pulling out of the complaint investigation process due to its representatives allegedly being obstructed. Accordingly , any demonstrations of interest in the Ethiopian process, however constructive or well-intentioned they may be, and this is clearly the case of this Parliament initiative, could be taken the wrong way, or could be used for nefarious purposes by those who have a vested interest in breaking up the democratisation process in Ethiopia.
ParallelChunk.fr: L’Union européenne doit donc envoyer un message clair au gouvernement, l’exhortant à cesser toutes attitudes répressives et provocatrices, en particulier à l’encontre des membres de l’opposition, des défenseurs des droits de l’homme et des journalistes indépendants, car une telle attitude hostile pourrait mener le pays dans un chaos total, ce qui ne sera profitable à personne.

Speaker.ParallelChunk: My duties as head of the electoral observation mission have not finished.

ParallelChunk.en: It is an independent mission, and the work is not yet done. I therefore ask Parliament to appreciate that I feel it is my duty not to take part in the vote on this resolution.
ParallelChunk.fr: Enfin, l’Union européenne doit exiger de la part du gouvernement qu’il assume ses responsabilités en vue de garantir la sécurité des citoyens et celle du nouveau parlement.

Speaker.name: Paul Marie Coûteaux (IND/DEM ).
Speaker.ParallelChunk: Mr President, I have to say, in support of the speech by my excellent fellow MEP, Mr Posselt that, from a certain point of view, we are very surprised at what has happened regarding the Saïfi report.
I should like us to evaluate the consequences for it is, at root, a sign addressed to all those who care about the Strasbourg seat.
Everyone knows that this seat is threatened.
Let us think again about this morning’s vote.

ParallelChunk.en: Independently of the issue raised by Mrs Saïfi’s report on an important subject, namely textiles, the debate on which ought not, in my opinion, to have been postponed for two months, given that it was an urgent matter, there is, in addition, the signal we have sent out by admitting that, as from 12.30 p.m. on Thursdays, it is impossible to do anything important in the Chamber of Parliament’s seat in Strasbourg, which I consider to be the main seat of the European Parliament. Given that our activities begin on Tuesday mornings, the fact that they cease on Thursday mornings would suggest, not to put too fine a point upon it, that the Strasbourg Parliament, in Strasbourg, only sits, roughly speaking, two days per month.
ParallelChunk.fr: Nous passons maintenant au vote.

Speaker.ParallelChunk: That is a consequence of which I would ask all of my fellow Members to assess the significance, and that is why I am raising a formal protest on this subject.

ParallelChunk.en: The specific characteristics of farming and market supply in the outermost regions are evident and are rightly acknowledged by the EU. In this context, and in light of recent experience, I feel that the thrust of the proposal, which is essentially to make the process more flexible, meets Portugal’s considerable interests in this issue.
ParallelChunk.fr: Je voudrais juste déclarer que j’ai eu des problèmes avec ma carte et la machine de vote et que je n’ai malheureusement pas pu voter sur mon propre rapport.

ParallelChunk.en: Our outermost regions – the Azores and Madeira – deserve special focus due to their specific situation, not least in the field of agriculture.
ParallelChunk.fr: Je voudrais toutefois qu’il soit consigné que j’étais pour, bien entendu.

ParallelChunk.en: I declare the session of the European Parliament adjourned.
ParallelChunk.fr: Le vote est clos.
